Uses of Class
ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components.PixelState

  • Packages that use PixelState 
    Package Description
    ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components  
    ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.service  

    • Uses of PixelState in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components

      Fields in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components declared as PixelState 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      PixelState[][] GamePanelImpl.gamePanel
      2D-Array of the game panel
      Methods in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components that return PixelState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      PixelState GamePanel.getState​(int x, int y)  
      PixelState GamePanelImpl.getState​(int x, int y)
      method "getState" pads pixels outside of the game panel with zeros padding (like in image processing) is necessary because once the corner pixel has to define its neighbours, it has to know if the pixel out out game panel is dead or alive (logically the pixels outside of the game panel have to be declared as dead) moreover, without padding the code is running to following error: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException" finally, the method "getState" checks the position of the coordinates, makes sure they are not out of game panel and requests the coordinates back
      PixelState Rules.nextState​(int x, int y, GamePanel gamePanel)  
      PixelState RulesImpl.nextState​(int x, int y, GamePanel gamePanel)
      the method "nextState" implements especially the other 2 methods contained in this class, namely "neighboursSituation" and "countAlivePixel" (it would be recommendable to understand firstly these before proceeding further with this method) however, target of the method "nextState" is to count the alive pixels once the number is determined, the rules listed above can be applied to the "static" pixel (this is the pixel at the position (2, 2) --> see also comments of the method "neighboursSituation" depicted below)
      static PixelState PixelState.valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static PixelState[] PixelState.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.components with parameters of type PixelState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void GamePanel.setState​(int x, int y, PixelState pixelState)  
      void GamePanelImpl.setState​(int x, int y, PixelState pixelState)
      method "setState" follows the same logic like the previous method ("getState") with the major difference, that it does not request the coordinates back but sets on this particular position the status of the pixel (even alive or dead)

    • Uses of PixelState in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.service

      Methods in ch.zhaw.gameconsoleapp.gameoflife.core.service with parameters of type PixelState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void GameServiceMainOperations.setDrawing​(PixelState setDrawing)
      setter method relevant for the class "GameServiceButton" draws an alive or dead pixel (see also class "GameServiceButton" --> method "drawButton" and "deleteButton")
